newsitem.title: GERMANY: Deutz makes no results forecast for 1997.
newsitem.headline: Deutz makes no results forecast for 1997.

text.p: Troubled German machinery maker Deutz AG said on Friday it was not yet ready to forecast its results for 1997.

A Deutz spokesman, responding to a report by newsletter Platow Brief that the company would return to profit this year, told Reuters that 1996 results and outlook for 1997 would not be ready until the company's annual news conference on May 15.

Shares in Deutz, formerly called Kloeckner-Humboldt-Deutz AG and rescued by its banks in a one-billion-mark bailout last year, rose sharply on the Platow report, and at midday were trading at 10.75 marks, up from 8.46 marks at Thursday's close.

Last summer, Deutz forecast its 1996 sales would roughly equal the previous year's 3.288 billion marks, and said it would break even for the year after losing 1.134 billion marks the year before due to losses on Saudi cement plant contracts.
Deutsche Bank AG is Deutz's largest shareholder with a 48 percent stake and is also its largest creditor.
